intro: Horkelia truncata, commonly known as the Sierra larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture. Horkelia truncata is part of the tribe Lithospermeae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
